algorithm_technique: Sliding window to find the maximum number of 1s in a window of size equal to the total count of 1s.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum swaps to group all 1s together in a binary array.
problem_summary_technical: Use a sliding window of size equal to the total number of 1s to find the window with the maximum number of 1s.
key_insights: The problem is equivalent to finding a subarray of length equal to the total count of 1s that contains the maximum number of 1s.
The minimum number of swaps is the total count of 1s minus the maximum number of 1s found in any such subarray.
A sliding window approach efficiently calculates the number of 1s in all possible contiguous subarrays of the required length.
